answers.answer: Have your doctor check for Lyme disease if he hasn't. Lyme disease can cause joint pain, fatigue, muscle weakness, etc. Check out this website http://www.lymediseaseassociation.org/ and on the left you will see a list of options to go to. Go a little ways downs and click on symptoms. It might help you. Hope this helps!pietiangel
I thought lyme too. You can test negative and still have it, so be persistent with the drs.

question: Need some help here please.  Has anyone heard of a virus that causes joint paint which moves from place to place-but mostly arms, hands , legs?  Some blurred vision, muscle weakness, and circulation problems(my skin looks like all my capillaries are at the surface), dry skin and increased thirst.  I've been to a general practitioner, eye doctor, and neurologist.  I have no fever and have had this for a month.  Done tons of blood tests-no diabetes, lupus, or rheumatoid arthritis. All my blood work looks good. Haven't had anything like this before and my kids and husband don't have it.I would appreciate any help from anybody who has any ideas.Thanks
title: Mystery problem??Virus?
